title: Pandas in Wuhan market? China’s COVID genetic study is out—it has problems
description: The study acknowledges raccoon dogs were present but reports some unlikely animals.

title: Sony worries Microsoft will only give it a “degraded” Call of Duty
description: "Our business would never recover," Sony exec says of potential substandard version.

title: In 2019, Volkswagen decided to create a car OS—how’s that going?
description: The CEO of CARIAD, VW's software arm, tells Ars what's been going on at work.

title: Jellyfish and flies use the same hormone when they’ve had enough to eat
description: The regulation of hunger may go back to the base of the animal family tree.

title: Samsung and AMD extend Exynos GPU partnership, hope to find customers
description: Samsung doesn't use Exynos in flagships anymore, but maybe mid-rangers will buy in.

title: NASA: Uranus has “never looked better” in spectacular Webb Telescope image
description: Telescope's Near-Infrared Camera also captures subtle new features of polar cap.

title: Tesla workers shared images from car cameras, including “scenes of intimacy”
description: Ex-staffers tell Reuters about internal image sharing: "We could see their kids."

title: PC gaming market is set to grow again after pandemic and overstock corrections
description: Non-Nvidia GPUs, big- and high-res displays, and a refresh cycle cited in report.

title: Why ChatGPT and Bing Chat are so good at making things up
description: A look inside the hallucinating artificial minds of the famous text prediction bots.

title: Bitcoin white paper is hidden away in macOS’s system folder for some reason
description: 184KB PDF appears to be a sample document for macOS's "Virtual Scanner."

title: Google cracks down on predatory loan apps
description: Action comes after borrowers report blackmail attempts by lenders.

title: Useful accessory upgrades for your MacBook Pro or Mac mini
description: Get the most out of your Mac workstation with tools for productivity and comfort.
